page.title: 09St Leonard's Church
page.content: St. Leonards church is found in a prominent postion overlooking the village of Old Warden.It was built in the 12th century,and has six bells,the oldest being 400 years old.Most of its windows are of stained glass.The main window is above the altar.Most of these windows feature religious scenes.Some are in memory of members of the Shuttleworth family.There are many beautiful carvings,some from Italy,Belgium and France,particularly carvings of snakes on the end of the pews.Some of the panels come from a private chapel in Bruges and are of Anne of Cleves,fourth wife of Henry V111. The porch was added in 1952 by Mrs. Dorothy Shuttleworth in memory of her son Richard the last squire of Old Warden.
